TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit PaperSize extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Specifies the size of a piece of paper.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This class is used by the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrinterSettings.PaperSizes%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PageSettings.PaperSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> properties to get the paper sizes that are available on the printer and to set the paper size for a page, respectively.
You can use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.%23ctor%2A> constructor to specify a custom paper size. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Height%2A> property values can be set only for custom <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize> objects.
For more information about printing, see the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing> namespace overview.
## Examples The following code example populates the `comboPaperSize` combo box with the printer's supported paper sizes. In addition, a custom paper size is created and added to the combo box. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.PaperName%2A> is identified as the property that will provide the display string for the item being added through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> property of the combo box. The example assumes that a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> variable named `printDoc` exists and that the specific combo box exists.
[!code-cpp[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/VB/source.vb#1)]

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string name, int32 width, int32 height) cil managed

Docs.param: The width of the paper, in hundredths of an inch.
The height of the paper, in hundredths of an inch.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize> created with this constructor always has its <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Kind%2A> property set to <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperKind>. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Height%2A> property values can be set only for custom <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize> objects.
## Examples The following code example populates the `comboPaperSize` combo box with the printer's supported paper sizes. In addition, a custom paper size is created and added to the combo box. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.PaperName%2A> is identified as the property that will provide the display string for the item being added through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> property of the combo box. The example assumes that a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> variable named `printDoc` exists and that the specific combo box exists.
[!code-cpp[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the height of the paper, in hundredths of an inch.
Docs.value: The height of the paper, in hundredths of an inch.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This height measurement is for the portrait orientation of the paper. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Width%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Height%2A> property values can be set only for custom <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize> objects.

Docs.exception: The property is not set to .

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.%23ctor%2A> constructor to specify a custom paper size.

Docs.exception: The property is not set to .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the type of paper.
Docs.value: The name of the type of paper.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can set the paper name only if the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.Kind%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperKind>.
## Examples The following code example populates the `comboPaperSize` combo box with the printer's supported paper sizes. The <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.PaperName%2A> is identified as the property that will provide the display string for the item being added through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A> property of the combo box. The example assumes that a <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PrintDocument> variable named `printDoc` exists and that the specific combo box exists.
[!code-cpp[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/PaperSource and PaperSize Example with Resolution/VB/source.vb#1)]

Docs.exception: The property is not set to .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an integer representing one of the values or a custom value.
Docs.value: An integer representing one of the values, or a custom value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table shows the integer values of the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize> enumeration members. A value equal to 48 or 49 or larger than 118 indicates a custom paper size; however, the <xref:System.Drawing.Printing.PaperSize.RawKind%2A> property will return the actual integer value for the size.
